intro: Manettia lygistum var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, and its simple, alternate leaves. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. The varietal name 'glabrata' refers to its smooth, hairless stems and leaves.
